div.p: Put the shirt on your back with this brand blowout. Featuring go-to tailors like Façonnable, Ted Baker, Duncan Quinn and Calvin Klein, as well as edgier upstarts like Ever, ComingSoon and Billy Reid (GQ’s designer of the year), there are also plenty of brands that carve out their own unique style niche by walking the line between banker and artist. Check out the goods from Rogues Gallery, Converse John Varvatos and Alpha Industries, or stock up on T-shirts from kings of cotton C & C California, James Perse and adidas SLVR.

It’s 1936 all over again with these exquisite replicas of Sky King tricycles and other beloved antique toys from Airflow Collectibles. The Sport Racer Plane’s propeller spins when you pedal, the Sky Kings themselves come in three different colors, and the Pink Speedster is not to be missed. Any of them will make for a delightfully retro trip to the playground.

Kids’ clothes made to exacting French standards of quality and style: that’s the Jacadi way. Fine button-down shirts for boys and pretty bow-beset frocks for girls are some of the classics in this sale. Or let Junior go Gallic with these “Club Nautique” polos. Mix and match from among these sturdy styles and make your little one the best-dressed on the block.

Vic Firth’s love of woodturning led the former Boston Symphony Orchestra timpanist to embark on two post-music careers: manufacturer of industry-standard drumsticks for percussionists, and maker of some of the world’s best salt and pepper mills. Sample the latter at this sale, which features a dozen models created in conjunction with superchef Mario Batali. Take your pick of sizes and colors, with most rendered in maple or cherry wood — although there are a few stainless-steel options, too.

This North Carolina-based company prides itself on making “antique furniture for the future.” Grab a seat at this sale, which features chairs, sofas, barstools and ottomans upholstered in colorful leathers, crisp linens and the occasional zebra-patterned hair-hide. Each piece is a hands-on project: Skilled craftsmen manually construct the hardwood frames and tie down the metal springs, while seamstresses sew and fit the coverings.

Girls who just wanna have fun with fashion need look no further: This Italian line is all about wit, whimsy and girlishness. Strapless dresses with big, center-front bows are both sexy and cute, while polka dot jackets with skinny red-patent belts look trim and tailored. There are also plenty of shoes like these stacked-heel sandals color-blocked with zany brights, or these pumps with scribble patterns and outsize rosettes.

Spring-cleaning reminder: you’re going to need to make some room in your closet for this one. It’s all here — laceless leather sneakers and eel loafers from Cesare Paciotti; cashmere hoodies and long johns by Richard Chai; leather shoes, bags and briefcases from Costume National Homme.

Know a girl who loves to dress up? She’ll love these sweet styles from Halabaloo, a brand that plays up all the girly details. Whether it’s a knit dress gussied up with pink rosettes and ruffle-y tiers or a special-occasion frock with embroidered hearts and floating layers of bow-printed organza, the offerings in this sale are too pretty to pass up.

Make a statement with this collection of bags and wallets, each of which is packed with personality without ever being ostentatious. From two-tone leather wallets to denim day bags to messenger bags in plaid wool, you’ll want to turn these items into your personal Property.

Leigh & Luca made their name with chic scarves featuring gorgeous graphics and embroidery. Now they’re bringing the same hip aesthetic to their brand-new line of bags, which are now available exclusively at Gilt well before they hit stores. The key to These full-priced fashion must-haves is versatility: The canvas hobos are big enough to be carry-alls but chic enough to carry off any ensemble.

Based in Bogota, Galena specializes in handcrafted pieces that blend South American craft traditions with natural materials. Try the company’s quietly beautiful cheese trays, which feature multiple wood veneers and German silver handles, or opt for its statement-making centerpiece platters, which come in a rainbow of colors. Bamboo serving utensils and bowls with silver accents are also on offer.

Here’s some lingerie that won’t make you blush — Stella McCartney brings her modern aesthetic and impeccable taste to her lovely line of intimates. These flattering bras and panties are perfect for everyday wear, but there are plenty of pretty pieces (think crystal and bow embellishments) for special occasions.

These furnishings for kids’ rooms strike a balance between modern and whimsical. The bed and matching nightstand in black and white can be read as cartoon-like or sophisticated, depending on how you style them. That’s where these colorful quilts come in. Their simple graphics are all about childlike fun. Continue that theme with these rugs featuring squiggly cars and trucks, or birds and flowers.

These furnishings for kids’ rooms strike a balance between modern and whimsical. The bed and matching nightstand in black and white can be read as cartoon-like or sophisticated, depending on how you style them. That’s where these colorful quilts come in. Their simple graphics are all about childlike fun. Continue that theme with these rugs featuring squiggly cars and trucks, or birds and flowers.

How many times a day do you look at your wrist to see what time it is? However often you do, the frequency is bound to increase when you’re wearing one of these beautiful Raymond Weil watches. Treat yourself to a diamond-accented, Swiss-made timepiece, or choose one of these luxe men’s watches for a very special gift.

Carolina Herrera is a living legend, and you can look like one too by wearing her sophisticated and impeccably cut designs. Show up at your next special occasion in a red carpet-worthy gown, like these floor-sweeping, off-the shoulder and strapless silk numbers. The Venezuela-born icon also crafts sublime cocktail dresses, jackets, coats and more.

Why keep all the good stuff inside? That’s the guiding principle behind this stunning collection of indoor/outdoor rugs by Safavieh, a carpet company that has been combining old-world techniques with modern designs for nearly a century. Made of 100% propylene, the Courtyard collection features bold floral and sophisticated geometric patterns; the rugs are also mold- and mildew-resistant. Fans of natural fibers will appreciate the sisal Martinique, as well as the hand-woven, wool-and-jute Dhurrie.

Known for its flattering pieces, this hot New York label manages to be sweet without being too girly and fresh without being too trendy. Ali Ro’s draped, hammered-silk dresses look fab on any figure, and if you’re a prints princess, don’t miss these modern floral frocks and blouses.

entry.title: Up to 60% Off Dresses by Antik Batik, Victoria Kids, Hype and More

div.p: One of the many delights of having a little girl is the chance to dress her in the prettiest frocks you can find. Perfect for a special occasions, the party dresses from Pippa & Julie and Marie Chantal have a precious, vintage quality to them. The clothes from Hype, Victoria and Antik Batik are a little more modern, and casual, but these tank dresses, cardigans and bloomer sets are adorable just the same.

The Falls proves that it’s the little things that matter most. From these ruffle-trim cardigans to these sheer silk blouses, The Falls collection is bohemian perfection. Look for the open-weave tops with tiered panels, or score silk halter dresses with delicate tie backs.

Two Southern sisters have created this fine jewelry line that marries elegance with modern design. Queen bees will love the diamond-bee earrings, pendants and even signet rings. The stud and drop earrings with sparkling, semi-precious stones should also garner some buzz.

The spring scarf is one of the hottest trends this year. If you don’t have one yet (or want more), you’re in for a real treat with Leigh & Luca's gorgeous go-tos. These hand-loomed wraps feature quirky motifs like butterflies, text, and recycle symbols. Also have a look at their cool line of graphic tees, made from a cotton-modal blend.

Based in Bogota, Galena specializes in handcrafted pieces that blend South American craft traditions with natural materials. Try the company’s quietly beautiful cheese trays, which feature multiple wood veneers and German silver handles, or opt for its statement-making centerpiece platters, which come in a rainbow of colors. Bamboo serving utensils and bowls with silver accents are also on offer.

Whether you’re looking for leather belts, wallets, messenger bags or cuffs, this sale has what you need. All of these items are handmade in the United States, and many come from a group of Amish artisans in Pennsylvania. And if you’re looking for a break from all the leather, have at these handy canvas tote bags.

Transform your bathroom into an oasis with these exceptionally soft and absorbent linens. Take your pick of luxurious cotton towels, ribbed shower curtains and reversible rugs, all offered in chic colors like pistachio, ivory and black.

How many times a day do you look at your wrist to see what time it is? However often you do, the frequency is bound to increase when you’re wearing one of these stately Raymond Weil watches. Leather, stainless steel and rose gold accent these Swiss-made timepieces that are built to last.

You’ll certainly find the beautifully crafted luggage that made Mulholland synonymous with luxury leather goods here, but you’ll also be able to create your own adventures a lot closer to home. Upgrade your golf game with these divot repair kits and practice putter holes, or spend a woozy weekend picnic with these wine carriers and sommelier cases.

Those who appreciate witty design will be enamored with Seybert’s colorful home accessories. Beautify your boudoir with faux snakeskin wastebaskets and soap dispensers, or amp up your table’s glam quotient with the glossy Croco napkin rings. Hand towels embroidered with floral motifs are a must, and don’t even think of missing out on the Ikat sequin placemats.

H2 at Hammerman, the chic design arm of a renowned estate-jewelry dealer in NYC, has found a winning combination by crafting fashionable baubles with Old World techniques and top-quality gems. Melt over these ornate diamond-and-sapphire pieces with vintage influences, or choose among modern bracelets, necklaces and earrings featuring a smattering of colorful, semi-precious stones cut to perfection.

Devon Leigh’s natural style quite literally rocks: This L.A. designer is known for using chunky stones (some rough, some cut) to create pieces that really pop. Take a geology lesson as you browse among necklaces, cuffs and earrings that feature agate, turquoise, chalcedony, rhodonite and more.

When you want a purse with wow factor, turn to Katherine Kwei’s creations. Her mastery of fringed and knotted exotic leather is so renowned it's even won over Gossip Girls like Taylor Momsen and Blake Lively. From all-day carryalls to out-for-the-evening clutches, each of these wonderfully stylish bags features incredible details.

Take a deep breath — Surface to Air’s edgy styles are bound to make you float. From studded leather jackets to sexy tops to drapey dresses, it’s no surprise that this downtown label is all about edge. But this hip brand’s roots are in denim, so don’t miss the washed-denim pencil skirt.

Voluspa spares no expense with its handcrafted candles, with everything from the composition of their wax to their packaging in dupioni-silk bags a product of great consideration. Sample the company’s scents, which range from the earthy White Copalli Amber to the zingy Italian Tangelo. Also check out the diffusers and moisturizer sets.

Designer Laurel Berman’s modern-day lady looks have that Jackie O vibe that never gets old. Simple, flawless and easily elegant, Black Halo features unique silhouettes and expert draping that lends just the right touch of classic glamour. Standout pieces include the silk cowlneck minidress in a metallic sand tone, and the cutout sleeveless dress in French blue.

Find the perfect warm-weather accessory in this plethora of lightweight cotton pareos that can be worn as scarves or skirts. Choosing among these exotically embellished wraps may not be easy, but it’s worth the effort. This sale also includes Antik Batik’s canvas totes, suede cross-body bags and leather sandals.

Named after its cone-shaped clusters of dark fruit, the Pinot Noir grape is known for its glorious difficulty in the vineyard. It’s equally known for the seductive wine it produces. Choose from Gilt Man and Wine.com’s selection of the world’s best Pinot Noir, culled from vineyards as far-ranging as France’s Cote D’Or and California’s Russian River Valley.

Puma has all your activewear needs covered. Gear from Puma Golf includes golf shoes, of course, but also eye-catching polos and track jackets. Puma RTW takes you off the links and onto the pavement with track suits and other sportswear, including many Ferrari pieces. Cart all this and more in Puma Accessories’ messenger bags, gym sacks and backpacks. And don’t forget the sneakers: more than two dozen different styles, to be precise, from the spartan Doshus to the riotous Easy Riders.

There are many ways to stay dry. You can stay indoors, but who wants to do that? As an alternative — or as several alternatives — consider these waterproof car coats, anoraks, packable trenches, peacoats and more from Allegri. All of them are made with exacting Italian standards of excellence, and all are built to last through years of unexpected downpours.

Chill, grill and juice with these handy devices from the first name in small kitchen appliances. First up in is the 6-bottle countertop wine cellar, whose thermoelectric cooling technology means it emits no noise or vibrations. Next is the Griddler, which can cook everything from pancakes and paninis to sausages and steaks. Finally, there is the 1000-watt juice extractor, which features a 3-inch feeding chute that can handle whole fruits and vegetables.

Stripes, checks and solids — the ingredients for classy dress shirts are simple, it's just a matter of how they’re put together. Enter Shirt by Shirt, which opens its factory doors to offer nearly 50 terrific variations, with a particular predilection for multicolored plaids. This tantalizing variety — all at huge discounts — will give your closet a fresh new look.

Slim jeans and even slimmer jeans — they’re called stick jeans, in case you’re wondering — sit fashionably next to reversible hoodies, knit cardigans and crewneck T-shirts in this extensive sale from Corpus, which has moved well beyond its denim origins. A few wild cards keep things interesting (drop-crotch pants, shawl-collar dress shirts), but the Corpus look is still classic and clean.

Alert your wristwatch that it will soon have some competition. Loma specializes in Art Deco-inspired enamel and sterling-silver cufflinks, including pieces inspired by the tracery in Gothic architecture. Or, if fabric-on-fabric is more your thing, Robert Graham's cufflinks use actual swatches from boldly patterned Robert Graham shirts.

Named after its cone-shaped clusters of dark fruit, the Pinot Noir grape is known for its glorious difficulty in the vineyard. It’s equally known for the seductive wine it produces. Choose from Gilt Man and Wine.com’s selection of the world’s best Pinot Noir, culled from vineyards as far-ranging as France’s Cote D’Or and California’s Russian River Valley.

Puma is the coolest cat in town, bringing you everything from running shoes to handbags with equal finesse. You’ll love the urban sensibility of these metallic satchels, nylon hobos, multicolor high-tops and athletically-inclined Cell sneaker series.

Chill, grill and juice with these handy devices from the first name in small kitchen appliances. First up in is the 6-bottle countertop wine cellar, whose thermoelectric cooling technology means it emits no noise or vibrations. Next is the Griddler, which can cook everything from pancakes and paninis to sausages and steaks. Finally, there is the 1000-watt juice extractor, which features a 3-inch feeding chute that can handle whole fruits and vegetables.

This company began as a way to make interesting use of wood off-cuts from the production of large furniture pieces; now its artisans craft a full line of tables and seating that offers an exquisite take on East meets West. Made of teak and synthetic rattan, the Monticello chair and ottoman are modern, outdoor versions of Thomas Jefferson's classic Campeachy designs. And the simple, pure lines of the teak-and-stainless-steel Stratus collection? They give Scandinavian furniture a run for its money.

Named after its cone-shaped clusters of dark fruit, the Pinot Noir grape is known for its glorious difficulty in the vineyard. It’s equally known for the seductive wine it produces. Choose from Gilt Man and Wine.com’s selection of the world’s best Pinot Noir, culled from vineyards as far-ranging as France’s Cote D’Or and California’s Russian River Valley.

It’s all about the details in this print- and color-happy collection. Williamson’s award-winning expertise shines in these dresses with artful jewel embellishments, the shoes built with architectural platforms and, most of all, in the wild and wonderful prints that have made Williamson a design darling in Britain.

A little L.L. Bean and a little Hermès, Amy Kizer’s line of pet carriers and accessories was an instant hit when she debuted it in 1998. Dress your pooch in style with the merino wool sweaters, or take her out on the town in the messenger pouches.

entry.title: John Varvatos Star USA Clothing and Shoes

div.p: Even rock stars need to dress up sometimes: induction ceremonies, court dates, that sort of thing. This John Varvatos Star USA sale has the lambskin biker jackets and velvet pants you’ve come to expect from the rock-loving man who snatched up the old CBGB space for his Manhattan storefront. But you’ll also find a fleet of dress shorts, suits and even neckties, all of them crisp and a bit brash but unmistakably grown-up. It happens.

Prep for bikini season properly with these kits that include exfoliating towelettes to get skin ready, as well as towelettes with the perfect amount of self-tanner. It’s a combination that ensures streak-free color and skin that’s smooth, moisturized and sun-ready. Stock up with these 10-packs and you’ll be covered all summer long.

This British furniture and fabric house is known for its boho chic and statement pieces, but founder Martin Waller’s inspirations also come from far beyond England’s green fields. The company’s kilim trunk is a coffee table upholstered in Eastern tapestries, while the U.S. Flag Hirschorn chair is a mod take on Arne Jacobsen’s Egg chair. Other pieces incorporating flags also abound, from the Armstrong sofa to the outsider-art-esque Fante cushions.

That four-minute mile will look a bit more within reach when you slip into this hi-tech workout wear. While these shirts, jackets and shorts reduce moisture and are chafe-resistant, they give up nothing in terms of appearance. Tiny splashes of bold colors like Racer Red and Flashback Green see to it that you’ll stay stylish at any speed.

A sneaky diagonal cut transforms a gray-and-navy striped sweater. Cutaway blazers and trench coats take on new life in tartan plaid. A cardigan is married with a hoodie to create an eye-popping royal-blue statement-maker. Typical looks take on unmistakable twists in Vanishing Elephant’s modern-meets-preppy aesthetic. A few more traditional pieces anchor the overall look, but whether you’re looking for daring or dependable, this sale has it.

Think of this sale as the perfect way to fill your weekend bag for a quick trip to the shore. The blue shorts and V-neck tees will keep you cool in more ways than one during the day; then, as the temperature drops, switch over to these cuffed pants (in the same shade of blue) and either — or both — of these subtly accented cashmere sweaters. Toothbrush and dog-eared paperback not included.

You like to take some chances and make the occasional spurge with your outfits. Why not do the same — minus the splurge, given Gilt’s great deals — with your underwear? Square-cut tanks add a futuristic gloss on your typical undershirt (although the more standard V-necks and crewnecks are also available), while an array of briefs, boxer briefs and trunks come in arresting colors with daring bits of stitching.

This French company’s stainless-steel flatware is full of life and color, with its signature bright enamel handles available in a rainbow of hues. Shop the sale for the five-piece Natura place settings, or opt for the serving and cheese duos. And if you want to add a quick hit of pizzazz, try the butter spreaders and demi spoons. They’re guaranteed to enliven white china.

Get a deep — and even — suntan without ever leaving your office. With TanTowel’s revolutionary single-use towelettes, you can unleash your inner surf-god Kelly Slater in just a few hours. TanTowel’s patented formula allows for a no-mess, no-fuss, no-streak application, and several of the kits also come with tanning mists and/or moisturizing X-Foliator towelettes.

Classy meets casual with this diverse array of items. Fremont, the label named after the famous street from Las Vegas' 1960s heyday, has just about every situation covered: linen/cotton short-sleeve shirts for the beach, black jeans for the clubs, cardigans for the office and boldly patterned tanks for the gym.

There's plenty of color in Tracy Reese's Plenty collection — and also plenty of ruffles and embroidery. Her ever-adorable style expertly blends ladylike details with modern trends, as in these flouncy silk-chiffon blouses, tie-waist dresses and jersey dolman cardigans.

entry.title: Marc Bouwer Glamit! and Bianca Nero

div.p: Be the belle of the ball in these fantastic frocks by Marc Bouwer Glamit! and Bianca Nero. Marc Bouwer’s jewel-toned evening gowns stand out with intricate details and unexpected draping, while his cocktail dresses flaunt their ruffles. Bianco Nero’s on-trend offerings include bandage dresses, thin-belted satin dresses and long gowns with plunging V-necks.

This British furniture and fabric house is known for its boho chic and statement pieces, but founder Martin Waller’s inspirations also come from far beyond England’s green fields. The company’s kilim trunk is a coffee table upholstered in Eastern tapestries, while the U.S. Flag Hirschorn chair is a mod take on Arne Jacobsen’s Egg chair. Other pieces incorporating flags also abound, from the Armstrong sofa to the outsider-art-esque Fante cushions.

These cool duds for kids sport skater and punk icons, yet the graffiti- and tattoo-inspired prints are given a tot-friendly twist. Check out the cute tees for fans of “The Noisy Toys” or the images of kids hitching rides with dinosaurs. Little message tees give new meaning to terms like “Damage Control,” and there are even adorable brother-sister sets.

This line of kids’ stationery from former magazine art director and children's book designer, Robyn Miller, pops with colorful illustrations. Birthday-party invitations and matching thank-you cards sport green frogs, red ladybugs, pink butterflies and yellow princess crowns. Kids will love the fun pictures, while parents will appreciate the elegant paper stock. Plus, every card is made with recycled paper certified by the Forest Council Stewardship.

This French company’s stainless-steel flatware is full of life and color, with its signature bright enamel handles available in a rainbow of hues. Shop the sale for the five-piece Natura place settings, or opt for the serving and cheese duos. And if you want to add a quick hit of pizzazz, try the butter spreaders and demi spoons. They’re guaranteed to enliven white china.

Get ready to ruffle with these frilly frocks and tops from Marc by Marc Jacobs. This retro-modern collection features plenty of prints (geometric, chevron stripes, ikat), buttons and bows as well as the sweet sense of whimsy we’ve come to expect from one of American’s most creative contemporary designers.

entry.title: Cesare Paciotti, Pauric Sweeney and Oscar de la Renta

div.p: Shoes, glorious shoes! Cesare Paciotti and Oscar de la Renta pull out all the stops with these top-of-the-line sandals, pumps and loafers. Pauric Sweeney adds to the mix these swoon-inducing, exotic-skin satchels and clutches for those who want to maximize their accessories from shoulder to toe.

No other designer captures the goddess look better than Alberta Ferretti. The flutters, draping and elegant cuts that are Ferretti signatures transform mere mortals into paragons of timeless chic. Take these dove gray column gowns with artful embellishment and chiffon trim, or the bevy of Empire waist dresses with intricate pleating and delicate cutaway hems. For daytime, these suits are a more structured approach to that same femininity.

A celebrity favorite for its bold use of color and hardware, this collection from Rebecca Minkoff covers every handbag need. From roomy metallic hobos to box clutches in hard-to-find shades to mini circle bags with chain straps, there’s a luxe leather style for every fashion whim.

Free People is designed for the creative and daring young woman who has fun experimenting with fashion. Mix materials with these gauze camis, or add layers with the relax-knit tees and boyfriend shirts. High-fashion trends meet everyday wearability in this seasonless collection of separates.

Variations on Eastern influences make these dresses and tunics pop. Cutout butterfly appliqués are the delicate embellishments on floating tops, while design elements of kimonos and cheongsams lend dresses and tunics an otherworldly elegance. Although Vivienne Tam’s line is designed in the fashion capital of the world, each piece harkens back to the archetypes of the Far East.

This party-loving line has broadened its base. In addition to must-have dresses, this sale also features adorably adorned tunics, jumpsuits and skirts. Thread Social cleverly combines stripes with solids and satins with chiffons for a thoroughly modern offering of styles that are both classic and completely of the moment.

It’s hard to believe shoes this chic are sustainably minded, but Coclico uses natural dyes and lightweight cork inside these swanky soles. Sandals with cutout details define this Spanish line’s style and there are plenty here in all iterations, from pretty T-straps with lattice-like patterns to peep-toe wedges to strappy flats.

William Rast reinterprets Americana with feminine-yet-tough takes on denim and leather. The line is famous for its body-hugging fits, and nowhere is that more evident than in these jeans. You’ll find bootcut, flare, straight and skinnies, and the brand’s leather jackets are just as cool with their trim cuts and funky fringe details. Don’t miss the plaid shirts and flag T-shirts, either.

Here’s a bit of everything you’ll need this summer, courtesy of one of menswear’s reigning giants. Need a coat? Take your pick among parkas, hoodies, bomber jackets and more. The tantalizing options don’t stop there, with pants, blazers, sweaters (don’t miss the colorblock V-neck), shirts and even shorts. All of it comes with the mix of modern experimentation and subtle nods to the past that Jacobs is known for.

Nothing generic about these shoes, which put masterful spins on reliable men’s styles. Chuck your old Oxford lace-ups and try these suede pairs in deep navy (that’s right: blue suede shoes). Perforated Italian leather enlivens both high-top sneakers and these charming Tuxman cap-toes. These, along with dozens of other models, can be found in this one-of-a-kind sale.

Attention, urban (or suburban) cowboys: RRL Jeans has a tack box’s worth of rugged accessories ready for you. Ralph Lauren’s Wild West-inspired line has a soft spot for leather and canvas belts, including a particularly studly studded number, and you’ll also find satchels, backpacks and even suspenders. Think of Gilt Man as the ultimate dry goods shop.

Put your pedals to the metal/pavement/dirt/wherever — and look great doing it — with this must-see joint sale for bicyclists. Cannondale has more stylish bike jerseys and jackets than there are Tour de France stages, not to mention gloves and baggy shorts. And be sure to check out Pearl Izumi’s quick-drying P.R.O. zip-front jersey, available in three different styles.

Upgrade your closet with richly understated dress shirts from Michael Kors (in subtle and not-so-subtle stripes) and Elie Tahari (more stripes, plus a handful of checks). Mezlan puts a series of exotic spins on typical dress shoe styles, each handmade in Spain. And top it all off with either of these sophisticated scents from Baxter of California.

With warm weather come skin-baring fashions. But when the sun goes down, better have a couple wraps on hand. These luxe lengths of cashmere and silk come in saturated shades of pink, turquoise and coral. There are also the classic choices of black, gray or ecru with textural touches like drop-stitching or pointelle.

Simple jersey shell tops become so much more when they’re cut from feathery tencels and cottons and embellished with chains, studs and fringe. They become essential pieces of carefree chic. The four New York designers that comprise the label Smitten find inspiration from vintage fashions for these artfully draped tunics, vests and cardigans.

Alexander McQueen may no longer be with us, but his uncompromising embrace of luxury in its more daring forms lives on. Dress shirts appear both in sheer and opaque varieties, the perfect complements for hologram belts and iridescent patent leather loafers. Other items are more sedate ⎯ hummingbirds surface on neckties, on the shoulders of T-shirts and even across the front of a stunning silk blazer ⎯ but the overall effect is as daring as ever.

Pastels, pearls, crystals and silver make an ultra-feminine mix in this collection. RJ Graziano offers classic jewelry styles like chandelier earrings, chokers and cuff bracelets but there are also more whimsical designs like these stone-studded flower necklaces and dragonfly brooches.
